observation: I can see a country selection dropdown is open with many countries listed. I can see countries from Albania through Zimbabwe alphabetically. There's a red Next button at the bottom. Since I previously selected Australia (which appears to be working), I should now click the Next button to proceed with the registration flow. The button has good contrast and is appropriately sized for an elderly user.
reasoning: As a 70-year-old user, I need to proceed to the next step after selecting my country. I can see the Next button clearly at the bottom of the screen. It's a good size (48px height) and has good contrast (red background). This will take me forward in the sign-up process.
ux_issues: The country dropdown list is very long and requires significant scrolling - could benefit from search functionality or regional grouping for elderly users

issues: The country dropdown list is very long and requires significant scrolling - could benefit from search functionality or regional grouping for elderly users

dual_diagnosis.visual_observation: The Next button was tapped but the page did not progress. Instead, a red error message 'Please select your country/region.' appeared below the dropdown, and a red loading spinner is now visible on the Next button. The user remains on the same residence selection page.
dual_diagnosis.diagnosis: Form validation is preventing progression because no country/region was selected from the dropdown. The dropdown still shows 'Select' placeholder text, indicating required field validation is working as intended.
